description:
Given an input string, this function can be used to apply the strip, rstrip, or lstrip functions on it, thereby removing undesired whitespace and/or other characters.
E.g.
"     this   is   a   string    " -strip-> "this   is   a   string" 
"     this   is   a   string    " -rstrip-> "     this   is   a   string" 
"aaaaahelloaaaa" -> strip(a) -> "hello"

inputs.description: The string on which to apply the strip operation.
inputs.name: string_in

inputs.description: If additional characters are desired to be stripped from the input string, this function can be used.
inputs.name: string_chars_to_strip

inputs.description:
If desired, a specific strip function can be specified:
lstrip -> strip only from the left
rstrip -> strip only from the right
(defaults to regular strip)
inputs.name: string_strip_function

outputs.description: The string after applying the strip function.
